answers.answer: Hi there!Your blood sugar levels do not seem to be deranged nor do any other of your symptoms specify the need to suspect diabetes. It is normal for the blood sugar to rise after food and as long as these are within the specified range there is no cause to suspect diabetes. I would suggest getting the headaches and the blurred vision evaluated by a primary care physician or an ophthalmologist for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate management.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: I am a healthy 18 year old male and i recently did blood work because i was worried that i might have diabetes the blood work came back saying i had 83 blood sugar which is perfect blood sugar  but i have gotten for a while now even after the test these headaches and i got one about 30 minutes ago i used a blood glucose meter to check my blood sugar i was given it by my doctor and my blood sugar was 131 and in the morning its 79-90 which is normal i ate a peanut butter sandwich maybe 1 hour ago but that those not explain the headache at the same time with that high of blood sugar and recently i have gotten double vision no glasses work or take away the ghosting image anyways  even afher i eat it would never hit 131 please explain to me what is this do i have Diabetes?also i am 5'4 116 pound workout 3 times a week
title: I am worried i may have Diabetes
